info.name: Language Translator
info.description: IBM Watson™ Language Translator translates text from one language to another. The service offers multiple IBM provided translation models that you can customize based on your unique terminology and language. Use Language Translator to take news from across the globe and present it in your language, communicate with your customers in their own language, and more.

query.description: Release date of the API version you want to use. Specify dates in YYYY-MM-DD format. The current version is `2018-05-01`.

variable.description: Model ID of the model to delete.

response.name: Success: Model deleted
Invalid request. See the response body for details.
The specified model was not found.

query.description: Release date of the API version you want to use. Specify dates in YYYY-MM-DD format. The current version is `2018-05-01`.

variable.description: Model ID of the model to get

request.description: Gets information about a translation model, including training status for custom models. Use this API call to poll the status of your customization request. A successfully completed training will have a status of `available`.

response.name: Status : OK
Invalid request. See the response body for details.
The specified model was not found.

query.description: Specify a language code to filter results by source language.
Specify a language code to filter results by target language.

If the default parameter isn't specified, the service will return all models (default and non-default) for each language pair. To return only default models, set this to `true`. To return only non-default models, set this to `false`. There is exactly one default model per language pair, the IBM provided base model.
Release date of the API version you want to use. Specify dates in YYYY-MM-DD format. The current version is `2018-05-01`.

response.name: Success
Invalid request. See the response body for details.

query.description: The model ID of the model to use as the base for customization. To see available models, use the `List models` method. Usually all IBM provided models are customizable. In addition, all your models that have been created via parallel corpus customization, can be further customized with a forced glossary.
An optional model name that you can use to identify the model. Valid characters are letters, numbers, dashes, underscores, spaces and apostrophes. The maximum length is 32 characters.
Release date of the API version you want to use. Specify dates in YYYY-MM-DD format. The current version is `2018-05-01`.

request.description: Uploads Translation Memory eXchange (TMX) files to customize a translation model. You can either customize a model with a forced glossary or with a corpus that contains parallel sentences. To create a model that is customized with a parallel corpus and a forced glossary, proceed in two steps: customize with a parallel corpus first and then customize the resulting model with a glossary. Depending on the type of customization and the size of the uploaded corpora, training can range from minutes for a glossary to several hours for a large parallel corpus. You can upload a single forced glossary file and this file must be less than 10 MB. You can upload multiple parallel corpora tmx files. The cumulative file size of all uploaded files is limited to 250 MB. To successfully train with a parallel corpus you must have at least 5,000 parallel sentences in your corpus. You can have a maximum of 10 custom models per language pair.

response.name: Not found: The base_model_id value is invalid
File size exceeded: Payload body exceeded the limit

Forbidden: You may have reached the limit of 10 custom models per language pair or the service instance's plan id does not allow for customization. Currently, only service instances on the advanced or premium plans are allowed to customize
Bad request: The base_model_id is not specified OR you've hit the maximum limit of customizations for this user
Success: Training has successfully started
